intro: Labordia molokaiana, commonly known as the Moloka`i hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian island of Moloka`i. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its large, showy flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are broad, heart-shaped, and often covered in fine hairs. Labordia molokaiana is adapted to the dry, coastal environments of its native habitat and is considered a rare and endangered species.
